thread.title: Walmart Leaves Grocery Market That Is Tougher Than the U.S., for Now

author: Stephen Wilmot
title: Walmart Leaves Grocery Market That Is Tougher Than the U.S., for Now
text:
Walmart’s reputation for low prices will be burnished by the sale of its U.K. business for—on paper—less than it paid for it almost two decades ago. In a tough market, though, this may have been the least bad option open to the U.S. retail behemoth.
Walmart bought the U.K.’s third-largest grocery chain, Asda, in 1999 for $11.4 billion, including net debt, outbidding a local rival. It is now merging Asda with Sainsbury, the U.K.’s second-largest grocery chain, to create a market leader. At current market prices, the deal... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
